***N.B.*** *This Policy will only pay for a claim made under either Sections 40 or 41 for the same event but not for more than one of the Sections.*

#### Section 42. Travel Curtailment due to COVID-19
We shall pay up to the Benefit Limit for:
a. the unused portion of irrecoverable prepaid tour fares or transport or accommodation costs included in the Trip; or
b. additional travelling (economy air ticket) and accommodation expenses reasonably incurred to alter Your stay outside Singapore prior to Your immediate return to Singapore arising from necessary and unavoidable Curtailment of the planned Trip as a direct result of:
i. You or Your Travel Companion are Diagnosed with COVID-19 during the Trip and confirmed by a Registered Medical Practitioner;
ii. Death or hospitalization of Your Immediate Family Member due to COVID-19.

Provided that if the original return ticket is not valid for the return, You shall surrender any unused portion of the return ticket to Us.
questions: How does the policy handle claims under Sections 40 and 41 if the same event triggers both, and what implications does this have for claiming under Section 42 for COVID-19 related curtailment?
What types of expenses are covered under Section 42 for travel curtailment due to COVID-19, and how are unused prepaid costs and additional travel expenses differentiated?
Under what specific COVID-19 related circumstances does Section 42 provide coverage for curtailment, and what documentation is required to confirm these conditions?
How does the policy define the role of a Registered Medical Practitioner in confirming a COVID-19 diagnosis for the insured or their Travel Companion during the trip?
What are the conditions under which additional economy air ticket and accommodation expenses are considered 'reasonably incurred' and eligible for reimbursement under Section 42?
In the event of death or hospitalization of an Immediate Family Member due to COVID-19, how does Section 42 address travel curtailment claims, and what proof is necessary?
How does the policy handle the surrender of unused return tickets if the original return ticket is no longer valid due to COVID-19 related trip curtailment?
What limitations or exclusions might apply to claims for additional travel and accommodation expenses incurred due to COVID-19 curtailment under Section 42?
How does the policy distinguish between the unused portion of prepaid tour fares and additional expenses incurred after curtailment, and how are these reimbursed under Section 42?
What is the definition of 'Immediate Family Member' in the context of COVID-19 related travel curtailment claims under Section 42, and how does this affect eligibility?
How does the policy ensure that claims for COVID-19 related travel curtailment are not duplicated across Sections 40, 41, and 42, and what procedures must the insured follow?
In cases where the insured or Travel Companion is diagnosed with COVID-19 during the trip, what is the timeframe for reporting and claiming under Section 42?
How does the policy address scenarios where the insured's original return ticket remains valid despite COVID-19 related curtailment, and how does this affect claim payments?
What are the implications for coverage if the insured voluntarily chooses to curtail the trip due to COVID-19 fears without a confirmed diagnosis or hospitalization of an Immediate Family Member?
How does Section 42 interact with any general policy exclusions related to pandemics or communicable diseases, and which provisions take precedence?
What documentation is required to prove the necessity and unavoidability of trip curtailment due to COVID-19 under Section 42, including medical and travel records?
How does the policy define 'Travel Companion' for the purpose of COVID-19 diagnosis and claim eligibility under Section 42?
Are there any limits on the benefit amount payable under Section 42 for combined unused prepaid costs and additional expenses, and how is the Benefit Limit applied?
How does the policy treat additional accommodation expenses incurred if the insured must quarantine abroad due to a COVID-19 diagnosis during the trip under Section 42?
What are the conditions under which the policy will not pay for claims under Section 42, such as if the curtailment is due to reasons other than those explicitly related to COVID-19?
